alert.note: Alert for Dale; Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 27 at 12:19PM CDT until March 27 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Alabama, including the following counties, Dale and Henry. * WHEN...Until 215 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1219 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Graball, Lawrenceville, Abbeville Municipal A/P, Murphy Station, Screamer, Scottsboro Crossroads, Edwin, Double Bridges, Thomas Mill Creek, Clopton, Otho, Coates, Bertha, Snells Crossroads, Barefield Crossroads, Bells Crossroads and Walter F. George Lock And Dam. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
